title: Twisted League/Guide/Farming

properties.name: description
properties.value: Before level 45 Farming, the only traditional Farming patches available to the player are found in Hosidius, with two allotment patches, one herb patch, and one flower patch. With at least 50% Hosidius favour, this group of patches will be immune to disease. A Spirit tree patch can also be found in Hosidius, though it can not be used until much higher Farming levels. At level 34 Farming and 100% Hosidius favour, the Tithe Farm minigame becomes available, allowing for focused Farming training rather than simply waiting for crops to grow. With level 36 Farming, the Hosidius Vinery can also be farmed with Grape seeds, which can be bought from Farmer Gricoller's Rewards at the Tithe Farm.

content:
Twisted League


Contents

  • 1 Information
    • 1.1 Farming patches
    • 1.2 Equipment
  • 2 Seeds
    • 2.1 Pickpocketing Master farmers
    • 2.2 Farming contracts
    • 2.3 Other
  • 3 Training
    • 3.1 1+ : Ploughing fields
    • 3.2 1+ : Farming patches
    • 3.3 34+ : Tithe Farm

Information[edit | edit source]

Farming patches[edit | edit source]

The location of the Hosidius Farming patches.

Before level 45 Farming, the only traditional Farming patches available to the player are found in Hosidius, with two allotment patches, one herb patch, and one flower patch. With at least 50% Hosidius favour, this group of patches will be immune to disease. A Spirit tree patch can also be found in Hosidius, though it can not be used until much higher Farming levels. At level 34 Farming and 100% Hosidius favour, the Tithe Farm minigame becomes available, allowing for focused Farming training rather than simply waiting for crops to grow. With level 36 Farming, the Hosidius Vinery can also be farmed with Grape seeds, which can be bought from Farmer Gricoller's Rewards at the Tithe Farm.

At level 45 Farming, the player can enter the first section of the Farming Guild, and participate in the Farming contracts activity. This first section has two more allotment patches, a flower patch, a bush patch, and a cactus patch. At level 65 Farming the player can enter the second section of the Guild, which has a tree patch, a herb patch, the Anima patch, and the Hespori. At level 85 Farming the player can enter the final section of the guild, with its fruit tree patch, Spirit tree patch, Celastrus patch, and Redwood patch.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

Vannah's Farming Stall in Hosidius.

Most Farming equipment can be bought at Vannah's Farming Stall in Hosidius, or from Allanna's Farming Shop in the Farming Guild. Most farmers who watch over crops will also sell some farming supplies through their dialogue. Some unique Farming equipment can be bought Farmer Gricoller's Rewards at the Tithe Farm, such as the Gricoller's can and Farmer's outfit.

To make Supercompost, the easiest way is to simply plant Watermelon seeds in the two Allotment patches, and use them to fill up the nearby Compost Bins. Without Watermelons, one of the easiest ways to make Supercompost is by stealing from the Fruit Stalls in Hosidius. These stalls can give Jangerberries, Papayas, and Pineapples, which can be used to make Supercompost even at low Farming levels.

Seeds[edit | edit source]

Pickpocketing Master farmers[edit | edit source]

Main article: Master farmer

Starting at level 38 Thieving, it is possible to pickpocket Master farmers for seeds. Most of these seeds will be low-level, and it is not possible to pickpocket tree seeds or fruit tree seeds from them. Master farmers are mostly useful for training up through the early levels of Farming, before the player can get seeds through Farming contracts or train Farming at the Tithe Farm.

Farming contracts[edit | edit source]

The interior of the Farming Guild, where Guildmaster Jane can be found.
Main article: Farming contracts

With access to the Farming Guild at level 45 Farming, players can ask Guildmaster Jane for a Farming contract. Completing a contract gives a Seed pack as a reward, which can be opened for a variety of seeds depending on the contract's difficulty. Completing Farming contracts is one of the best ways to get mid-level and high-level seeds, and is a good way to gain seeds while passively training Farming in the guild anyways. Choosing the Unnatural Selection relic will allow players to choose their own farming contracts; this can greatly speed up seed pack acquisition if players choose back-to-back contracts for crops that have already grown but have not yet been checked or harvested. Unlike Slayer assignments, this relic does not allow players to choose the same farming contract twice in a row.

Other[edit | edit source]

Besides the two aforementioned "dedicated" ways to obtain seeds, it is likely for the player to passively accumulate seeds through a variety of other activities. One of the most common such activities is combat, with some high-level monsters like Lizardman shamans or Sarachnis commonly dropping high-level Farming seeds. On long Slayer tasks against monsters with multiple seed drops, it might be useful to bring along a Seed box, to save on inventory space. The Wintertodt's Supply crates also have a decent chance of giving seeds as a reward, with the quality of the seed depending on the player's Farming level.

Training[edit | edit source]

1+ : Ploughing fields[edit | edit source]

A player ploughs the fields.

At level 1 Farming, one way to get some early levels is by ploughing fields with a Plough in the south of Hosidius. Ploughing fields is the only way to gain Hosidius favour starting from 0%, so there is good chance the player would want to do this regardless. Ploughing the field will periodically give 50 Farming experience, which can add up to a few levels over time. While not a good long-term training method, it might be useful to skip some of the worst Farming crops, and get straight to planting something a bit better like Cabbage seeds.

1+ : Farming patches[edit | edit source]

At low levels, the most straightforward way to train Farming is to simply grow crops in the few patches available. With the boosted experience rates in the League, it should not take very much time before the player can move on to better methods or the different types of patches in the Farming Guild. Even activities such as raking weedy patches, filling Compost buckets from the Compost Bin, and using compost on a farming patch give small amounts of Farming experience. For the best experience rates, it is generally recommended that the player plants the highest-level seeds they have available, though other considerations such as Herblore training are important when considering what seeds to use.

34+ : Tithe Farm[edit | edit source]

A player tending to several logavano fruit plants.
Main article: Tithe Farm

Starting as low as level 34 Farming, it is possible to train the skill in a more "direct" manner through the Tithe Farm minigame. This activity also has a number of unique rewards, such as the Gricoller's can, Farmer's outfit, and Grape seeds. At level 34 Farming, it is possible to reach experience rates of up to 140,000 Farming experience per hour. At level 54 Farming, this rate increases up to 330,000 experience per hour. At level 74 Farming, it is possible to reach experience rates up to about 550k per hour. All of these rates can be doubled after choosing the Gift of the Gatherer relic. Also note, that these rates can be reached if the player is proficient at the minigame and makes no mistakes, so inexperienced players should expect lower amounts.

rawContent:
{{Twisted League Guide Links}}

==Information==
===Farming patches===
[[File:Hosidius Allotment location.png|right|250px|thumb|The location of the Hosidius Farming patches.]]
Before level 45 Farming, the only traditional Farming patches available to the player are found in [[Hosidius]], with two [[allotment patch]]es, one [[herb patch]], and one [[flower patch]]. With at least 50% Hosidius favour, this group of patches will be immune to disease. A [[Spirit tree patch]] can also be found in Hosidius, though it can not be used until much higher Farming levels. At level 34 Farming and 100% Hosidius favour, the [[Tithe Farm]] minigame becomes available, allowing for focused Farming training rather than simply waiting for crops to grow. With level 36 Farming, the Hosidius [[Vinery]] can also be farmed with [[Grape seed]]s, which can be bought from [[Farmer Gricoller's Rewards]] at the Tithe Farm.

At level 45 Farming, the player can enter the first section of the [[Farming Guild]], and participate in the [[Farming contracts]] activity. This first section has two more allotment patches, a flower patch, a [[bush patch]], and a [[cactus patch]]. At level 65 Farming the player can enter the second section of the Guild, which has a [[tree patch]], a herb patch, the [[Anima patch]], and the [[Hespori]]. At level 85 Farming the player can enter the final section of the guild, with its [[fruit tree patch]], Spirit tree patch, [[Celastrus patch]], and [[Redwood patch]]. 

===Equipment===
[[File:Vannah's Farming Stall.png|250px|thumb|Vannah's Farming Stall in Hosidius.]]
Most Farming equipment can be bought at [[Vannah's Farming Stall]] in [[Hosidius]], or from [[Allanna's Farming Shop]] in the [[Farming Guild]]. Most farmers who watch over crops will also sell some farming supplies through their dialogue. Some unique Farming equipment can be bought [[Farmer Gricoller's Rewards]] at the Tithe Farm, such as the [[Gricoller's can]] and [[Farmer's outfit]].

To make [[Supercompost]], the easiest way is to simply plant [[Watermelon seeds]] in the two [[Allotment patch]]es, and use them to fill up the nearby [[Compost Bin]]s. Without [[Watermelon]]s, one of the easiest ways to make Supercompost is by stealing from the [[Fruit Stall]]s in Hosidius. These stalls can give [[Jangerberries]], [[Papayas]], and [[Pineapples]], which can be used to make Supercompost even at low Farming levels.

==Seeds==
===Pickpocketing Master farmers===
{{Main|Master farmer}}
Starting at level 38 [[Thieving]], it is possible to pickpocket [[Master farmer]]s for seeds. Most of these seeds will be low-level, and it is not possible to pickpocket [[tree seeds]] or [[fruit tree seeds]] from them. Master farmers are mostly useful for training up through the early levels of Farming, before the player can get seeds through [[Farming contracts]] or train Farming at the [[Tithe Farm]].

===Farming contracts===
[[File:Farming Guild interior.png|thumb|250px|The interior of the Farming Guild, where Guildmaster Jane can be found.]]
{{Main|Farming contracts}}
With access to the [[Farming Guild]] at level 45 Farming, players can ask [[Guildmaster Jane]] for a [[Farming contract]]. Completing a contract gives a [[Seed pack]] as a reward, which can be opened for a variety of seeds depending on the contract's difficulty. Completing Farming contracts is one of the best ways to get mid-level and high-level seeds, and is a good way to gain seeds while passively training Farming in the guild anyways. Choosing the [[Unnatural Selection]] relic will allow players to choose their own farming contracts; this can greatly speed up seed pack acquisition if players choose back-to-back contracts for crops that have already grown but have not yet been checked or harvested. Unlike Slayer assignments, this relic does not allow players to choose the same farming contract twice in a row. 

===Other===
Besides the two aforementioned "dedicated" ways to obtain seeds, it is likely for the player to passively accumulate seeds through a variety of other activities. One of the most common such activities is combat, with some high-level monsters like [[Lizardman shaman]]s or [[Sarachnis]] commonly dropping high-level Farming seeds. On long [[Slayer]] tasks against monsters with multiple seed drops, it might be useful to bring along a [[Seed box]], to save on inventory space. The [[Wintertodt]]'s [[Supply crate]]s also have a decent chance of giving seeds as a reward, with the quality of the seed depending on the player's Farming level.

==Training==
===1+ : Ploughing fields===
[[File:Ploughing Hosidius field.png|right|thumb|250px|A player ploughs the fields.]]
At level 1 Farming, one way to get some early levels is by ploughing fields with a [[Plough]] in the south of [[Hosidius]]. Ploughing fields is the only way to gain Hosidius favour starting from 0%, so there is good chance the player would want to do this regardless. Ploughing the field will periodically give 50 Farming experience, which can add up to a few levels over time. While not a good long-term training method, it might be useful to skip some of the worst Farming crops, and get straight to planting something a bit better like [[Cabbage seed]]s.

===1+ : Farming patches===
At low levels, the most straightforward way to train Farming is to simply grow crops in the few patches available. With the boosted experience rates in the League, it should not take very much time before the player can move on to better methods or the different types of patches in the [[Farming Guild]]. Even activities such as [[Rake|raking]] weedy patches, filling [[Compost bucket]]s from the [[Compost Bin]], and using compost on a farming patch give small amounts of Farming experience. For the best experience rates, it is generally recommended that the player plants the highest-level seeds they have available, though other considerations such as [[Herblore]] training are important when considering what seeds to use.

===34+ : Tithe Farm===
[[File:Tithe Farm.png|thumb|250px|A player tending to several logavano fruit plants.]]
{{Main|Tithe Farm}}
Starting as low as level 34 Farming, it is possible to train the skill in a more "direct" manner through the [[Tithe Farm]] [[minigame]]. This activity also has a number of unique rewards, such as the [[Gricoller's can]], [[Farmer's outfit]], and [[Grape seed]]s. At level 34 Farming, it is possible to reach experience rates of up to 140,000 Farming experience per hour. At level 54 Farming, this rate increases up to 330,000 experience per hour. At level 74 Farming, it is possible to reach experience rates up to about 550k per hour. All of these rates can be doubled after choosing the Gift of the Gatherer relic. Also note, that these rates can be reached if the player is proficient at the minigame and makes no mistakes, so inexperienced players should expect lower amounts.

{{Twisted League}}
